title: Ticket #479: Accept --double-dash form for long arguments
description:
--double-dash appears to be the dominant form for long arguments, but Condor users -single-dash. The error message isn't terribly helpful: 

mustardseed(condor) condor_q --global
Error: unrecognized argument --global
Usage: condor_q [options]
        where [options] are
                -global                 Get global queue
                -submitter <submitter>  Get queue of specific submitter

Option 1: Better error message. Detect the case and offer the obvious correction. 

mustardseed(condor) condor_q --global
Error: unrecognized argument --global. Perhaps you meant -global?

Option 2: Silently parse it as a single dash. For example, if the argument matches the pattern ^--[A-Za-z], just remove the first dash before trying to parse. This Just Works. It also provides a long term path to making the --double-dash form the recommended default in the future.
